<EFX_PROPERTIES>
<A NAME="FIS_PROPERTIES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM&#160;2. &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;PROPERTIES.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	PGE&#8217;s principal property, plant, and equipment are generally located on land owned by the Company or land under the control of the Company pursuant to existing leases, federal or state licenses, easements, or other agreements. In some cases, meters and transformers are located on customer property. PGE leases its corporate headquarters complex, located in Portland, Oregon. The Indenture securing the Company&#8217;s First Mortgage Bonds (FMBs) constitutes a direct first mortgage lien on substantially all utility property and franchises, other than expressly excepted property.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	31
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#POR201610K_HTM_SADBBBD1F1A125EA8B49E90BBA5A61C2B">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_14"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Generating Facilities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The following are generating facilities owned by PGE as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Represents net capacity of generating unit as demonstrated by actual operating or test experience, net of electricity used in the operation of a given facility. For wind-powered generating facilities, nameplate ratings are used in place of net capacity. A generator&#8217;s nameplate rating is its full-load capacity under normal operating conditions as defined by the manufacturer.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Reflects PGE&#8217;s ownership share.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	PGE operates Boardman and has a 90% ownership interest.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

	(4)
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Talen Montana, LLC operates Colstrip and PGE has a 20% ownership interest.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(5)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	PGE operates Pelton and Round Butte and has a 66.67% ownership interest.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	PGE&#8217;s hydroelectric projects are operated pursuant to FERC licenses issued under the FPA. The licenses for the hydroelectric projects on the three different rivers expire as follows: Clackamas River, 2055; Willamette River, 2035; and Deschutes River, 2055.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Transmission and Distribution
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	PGE owns and/or has contractual rights associated with transmission lines that deliver electricity from its generation facilities to its distribution system in its service territory and also to the Western Interconnection. As of December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, PGE owned an electric transmission system consisting of 1,248 circuit miles as follows: 287 circuit miles of 500 kV line; 402 circuit miles of 230 kV line; and 559 miles of 115 kV line. The Company also has 27,259 circuit miles of distribution lines that deliver electricity to its customers.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	32
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company also has an ownership interest in the following:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Approximately 15% of the capacity on the Colstrip Project Transmission facilities from Colstrip to BPA&#8217;s transmission system; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

	Approximately 20% of the capacity on the Pacific Northwest Intertie, a 4,800&#160;MW transmission facility between John Day, in northern Oregon, and Malin, in southern Oregon near the California border. The Pacific Northwest Intertie is used primarily for the transmission of interstate purchases and sales of electricity among utilities, including PGE.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:4PX;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

	In addition, the Company has contractual rights to the following transmission capacity:

</EFX_PROPERTIES>

<A NAME="POR201610K_HTM_S161249C2CE7C5B67B2A220E71F13893F">
</A>
</DIV>
<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM&#160;3. &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;LEGAL PROCEEDINGS.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Dreyer, Gearhart and Kafoury Bros., LLC v. Portland General Electric Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, Marion County Circuit Court; and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Morgan v. Portland General Electric Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, Marion County Circuit Court.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In January&#160;2003, two class action suits were filed in Marion County Circuit Court (Circuit Court) against PGE. The Dreyer case seeks to represent current PGE customers that were customers during the period from April&#160;1, 1995 to October&#160;1, 2000 (Current Class) and the Morgan case seeks to represent PGE customers that were customers during the period from April&#160;1, 1995 to October&#160;1, 2000, but who are no longer customers (Former Class, together with the Current Class, the Class Action Plaintiffs). The suits seek damages of $190 million plus interest for the Current Class and $70 million plus interest for the Former Class, from the inclusion of a return on investment of Trojan in the rates PGE charged its customers.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In April&#160;2004, the Class Action Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Partial Summary Judgment and in July&#160;2004, PGE also moved for Summary Judgment in its favor on all of the Class Action Plaintiffs&#8217; claims. In December&#160;2004, the Judge granted the Class Action Plaintiffs&#8217; motion for Class Certification and Partial Summary Judgment and denied PGE&#8217;s motion for Summary Judgment. In March&#160;2005, PGE filed two Petitions with the Oregon Supreme Court asking the Supreme Court to take jurisdiction and command the trial Judge to dismiss the complaints, or to show cause why they should not be dismissed, and seeking to overturn the Class Certification.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In August&#160;2006, the Oregon Supreme Court issued a ruling on PGE&#8217;s Petitions abating these class action proceedings until the OPUC responded with respect to the certain issues that had been remanded to the OPUC by the Circuit Court. In October&#160;2006, the Circuit Court issued an Order of Abatement in response to the ruling of the Oregon Supreme Court, abating the class actions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Following the October 2014 decision of the Oregon Supreme Court upholding the OPUC refund order in the related Trojan regulatory proceeding, the Circuit Court granted PGE&#8217;s motion to lift the abatement in June 2015. PGE filed a motion for summary judgment dismissing the lawsuits.&#160;Following oral argument on PGE&#8217;s motion for summary judgment, Plaintiffs moved to amend the complaints.&#160;PGE opposed the request to amend.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On February 22, 2016, the Circuit Court denied the plaintiff&#8217;s motion to amend the Complaint and, on March 16, 2016, entered a general judgment that granted the Company&#8217;s motion for summary judgment and dismissed all claims by the plaintiffs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	33
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#POR201610K_HTM_SADBBBD1F1A125EA8B49E90BBA5A61C2B">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On April 14, 2016, the plaintiffs appealed the general judgment of the Circuit Court in the Court of Appeals for the State of Oregon. For additional information on this matter, see Note 17, Contingencies, in the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8.&#8212;&#8220;Financial Statements and Supplementary Data.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Puget Sound Energy, Inc. v. All Jurisdictional Sellers of Energy and/or Capacity at Wholesale Into Electric Energy and/or Capacity Markets in the Pacific Northwest, Including Parties to the Western System Power Pool Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission and Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals (collectively, Pacific Northwest Refund proceeding).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In 2001, the FERC called for a hearing to explore whether there may have been unjust and unreasonable charges for spot market sales of electricity in the Pacific Northwest from December&#160;25,&#160;2000 through June&#160;20,&#160;2001 (Pacific Northwest Refund proceeding). During that period, PGE both sold and purchased electricity in the Pacific Northwest. Although FERC&#8217;s original decision terminated the proceeding and denied the claims for refunds, upon appeal of this decision to the U.S. Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals (Ninth Circuit), the Ninth Circuit remanded the case to the FERC to, among other things, address market manipulation evidence and account for the evidence in any future orders regarding the award or denial of refunds in the proceedings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In response to the Ninth Circuit remand, the FERC issued several procedural orders that established an evidentiary hearing, defined the scope of the hearing, expanded the refund period to include January 1, 2000 through December 24, 2000 for certain types of claims, and described the burden of proof that must be met to justify abrogation of the contracts at issue and the imposition of refunds. Those orders included a finding by the FERC that the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Mobile-Sierra
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;public interest standard governs challenges to the bilateral contracts at issue in this proceeding, and the strong presumption under
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Mobile-Sierra
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;that the rates charged under each contract are just and reasonable would have to be specifically overcome either by: i) a showing that a respondent had violated a contract or tariff and that the violation had a direct connection to the rate charged under the applicable contract; or ii) a showing that the contract rate at issue imposed an excessive burden or seriously harmed the public interest. The FERC also held that a market-wide remedy was not appropriate, given the bilateral contract nature of the Pacific Northwest spot markets. Refund proponents appealed these procedural orders at the Ninth Circuit. On December 17, 2015, the Ninth Circuit held that the FERC reasonably applied the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Mobile-Sierra
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;presumption to the class of contracts at issue in the proceedings and dismissed evidentiary challenges related to the scope of the proceeding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Plaintiffs on behalf of the California Energy Resources Scheduling division of the California Department of Water Resources filed a request for rehearing on February 1, 2016. By order issued April 18, 2016, the Ninth Circuit denied plaintiffs&#8217; request for panel rehearing of its decision regarding application of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Mobile-Sierra
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;presumption.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In response to the evidence and arguments presented during the hearing, in May 2015, the FERC issued an order finding that the refund proponents had failed to meet the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Mobile-Sierra
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;burden with respect to all but one respondent. In December 2015, the FERC denied all requests for rehearing of its order. With respect to the remaining respondent, FERC ordered additional proceedings, and, in an order issued October 18, 2016, rejected the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Plaintiffs&#8217; request for refunds from the respondent, finding that the Plaintiffs had not met their Mobile-Sierra burden of proof.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company has settled all of the direct claims asserted against it in the proceedings for an immaterial amount. The settlements and associated FERC orders did not fully eliminate the potential for so-called &#8220;ripple claims,&#8221; which have been described by the FERC as &#8220;sequential claims against a succession of sellers in a chain of purchases that are triggered if the last wholesale purchaser in the chain is entitled to a refund.&#8221; As a result of the FERC orders to date, there are only two sellers from whom ripple claims could arise if those orders are overturned on appeal. Both of these sellers have now authorized on-the-record representations that they would not pursue ripple claims if they were required to pay refunds. As a result, the Company does not believe that it will incur any material loss in connection with this matter.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	34
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#POR201610K_HTM_SADBBBD1F1A125EA8B49E90BBA5A61C2B">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Portland General Electric Company v. Liberty Mutual Insurance Company and Zurich American Insurance Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, U.S. District Court of the District of Oregon.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In 2013, the Company entered into an agreement (Construction Agreement) with its engineering, procurement and construction contractor - Abeinsa EPC LLC, Abener Construction Services, LLC, Teyma Construction USA, LLC, and Abeinsa Abener Teyma General Partnership, an affiliate of Abengoa S.A. (collectively, the &#8220;Contractor&#8221;) - for the construction of Carty. Liberty Mutual Insurance Company and Zurich American Insurance Company (hereinafter referred to collectively as the &#8220;Sureties&#8221;) provided a performance bond of $145.6 million (Performance Bond) under the Construction Agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On December 18, 2015, the Company declared the Contractor in default under the Construction Agreement and terminated the Construction Agreement. On January 28, 2016, the Company received notice from the International Chamber of Commerce International Court of Arbitration that Abengoa S.A. had submitted a request for arbitration. In the request, Abengoa S.A. alleged that the Company&#8217;s termination of the Construction Agreement was wrongful and in breach of the agreement terms and does not give rise to any liability of Abengoa S.A. under the terms of a guaranty in favor of PGE and pursuant to which Abengoa S.A. agreed to guaranty certain obligations of the Contractor under the Construction Agreement. Abengoa S.A. is also seeking to implead the Contractor into this arbitration. PGE disagrees with the assertions in the request for arbitration and, on February 29, 2016, filed a complaint and motion for preliminary injunction in the U.S. District Court for the District of Oregon seeking to have the arbitration claim dismissed on the grounds that the Company has not made a demand under the Abengoa S.A. guaranty, and therefore the matter is not ripe for arbitration.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On March 28, 2016, Abengoa S.A. and several of its foreign affiliates filed petitions for recognition under Chapter 15 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code requesting interim relief, including an injunction precluding the prosecution of any proceedings against the Chapter 15 debtors. On March 29, 2016, a number of Abengoa S.A.&#8217;s U.S. subsidiaries, including the four entities that collectively comprise the Contractor, filed voluntary petitions for relief under Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code. As a result, on April 5, 2016, the U.S. District Court issued an order stating that the Company&#8217;s District Court action against Abengoa S.A. was stayed. In June 2016, the Company filed with the bankruptcy court in the Chapter 11 proceeding a motion for relief from stay with respect to the four entities that collectively comprise the Contractor, which allows the Company to bring claims against such entities in the U.S. District Court. On October 21, 2016, PGE filed a complaint in the U.S. District Court for the District of Oregon against Abeinsa for failure to satisfy its obligations under the Construction Agreement. For further information regarding this complaint, see &#8220;Portland General Electric Company v. Abeinsa EPC LLC, Abener Construction Services, LLC (formerly known as Abener Engineering and Construction Services, LLC), Teyma Construction USA LLC, and Abeinsa Abener Teyma General Partnership, U.S. District Court of the District of Oregon,&#8221; below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On March 9, 2016, the Sureties delivered a letter to the Company denying liability in whole under the Performance Bond. In the letter, the Sureties make the following assertions in support of their determination:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	that, because Abengoa S.A. has alleged that PGE wrongfully terminated the Construction Agreement, PGE must disprove such claim as a condition precedent to recovery under the Performance Bond; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	that, irrespective of the outcome of the foregoing wrongful termination claim, the Sureties have various contractual and equitable defenses to payment and are not liable to PGE for any amount under the Performance Bond.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
	The Company disagrees with the foregoing assertions and on March 23, 2016 filed a breach of contract action against the Sureties in the U.S. District Court for the District of Oregon. The Company&#8217;s complaint disputes the Sureties&#8217; assertion that the Company wrongfully terminated the Construction Agreement and asserts that the Sureties are responsible for the payment of all damages sustained by PGE as a result of the Sureties&#8217; breach of contract, including damages in excess of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$145.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;stated amount of the Performance Bond. Such damages include additional costs incurred by PGE to complete Carty.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	35
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#POR201610K_HTM_SADBBBD1F1A125EA8B49E90BBA5A61C2B">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On April 15, 2016, the Sureties filed a motion to stay this U.S. District Court proceeding, alleging that PGE&#8217;s claims should be addressed in the arbitration proceeding initiated by Abengoa S.A., and referenced above, because PGE&#8217;s claims are intertwined with the issues involved in such arbitration and all parties necessary to resolve PGE&#8217;s claims are parties to the arbitration. PGE opposed the motion and filed a motion to enjoin the Sureties from pursuing, in the ICC arbitration proceeding, claims relating to the Performance Bond.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On July 27, 2016, the judge denied the Sureties&#8217; motion to stay the case in favor of a pending ICC Arbitration and granted PGE&#8217;s motion for an injunction prohibiting the Sureties from pursuing any Performance Bond claims in the ICC Arbitration. The Sureties appealed the rulings to the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals. On December 13, 2016, the Ninth Circuit issued an Order staying the district court proceeding pending a decision on the Sureties&#8217; appeal.&#160;Oral argument on the Sureties&#8217; appeal is scheduled for May 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	For additional information on this matter, see Note 17, Contingencies, in the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8.&#8212;&#8220;Financial Statements and Supplementary Data.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Portland General Electric Company v. Abeinsa EPC LLC, Abener Construction Services, LLC (formerly known as Abener Engineering and Construction Services, LLC), Teyma Construction USA LLC, and Abeinsa Abener Teyma General Partnership,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;U.S. District Court of the District of Oregon.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On October 21, 2016, PGE filed a complaint in the U.S. District Court of the District of Oregon against Abeinsa for failure to satisfy its obligations under the Construction Agreement. PGE is seeking damages from Abeinsa in excess of $200 million for: i) costs incurred to complete construction of Carty, settle claims with unpaid contractors and vendors, and remove liens; and ii) damages in excess of the construction costs, including a project management fee, liquidated damages under the Construction Agreement, legal fees and costs, damages due to delay of the project, warranty costs, and interest. For additional information on this matter, see Note 17, Contingencies, in the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8.&#8212;&#8220;Financial Statements and Supplementary Data.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>

<EFX_MARKET>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM&#160;5.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MARKET FOR REGISTRANT&#8217;S COMMON EQUITY, RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS AND ISSUER PURCHASES OF EQUITY SECURITIES.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;TEXT-INDENT:-96PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	PGE&#8217;s common stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the ticker symbol &#8220;POR&#8221;. As of February 3, 2017, there were 800
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	holders of record of PGE&#8217;s common stock and the closing sales price of PGE&#8217;s common stock on that date was $43.55
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	per share. The following table sets forth, for the periods indicated, the highest and lowest sales prices of PGE&#8217;s common stock as reported on the NYSE.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	36
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>

	While PGE expects to pay regular quarterly dividends on its common stock, the declaration of any dividends is at the discretion of the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors. The amount of any dividend declaration will depend upon factors that the Board of Directors deems relevant and may include, but are not limited to, PGE&#8217;s results of operations and financial condition, future capital expenditures and investments, and applicable regulatory and contractual restrictions.
</FONT>

Such forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, statements that relate to expectations, beliefs, plans, assumptions and objectives concerning future results of operations, business prospects, future loads, the outcome of litigation and regulatory proceedings, future capital expenditures, market conditions, future events or performance and other matters. Words or phrases such as &#8220;anticipates,&#8221; &#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;estimates,&#8221; &#8220;expects,&#8221; &#8220;intends,&#8221; &#8220;plans,&#8221; &#8220;predicts,&#8221; &#8220;projects,&#8221; &#8220;will likely result,&#8221; &#8220;will continue,&#8221; &#8220;should,&#8221; or similar expressions are intended to identify such forward-looking statements.

PGE&#8217;s expectations, beliefs and projections are expressed in good faith and are believed by the Company to have a reasonable basis including, but not limited to, management&#8217;s examination of historical operating trends and data contained either in internal records or available from third parties, but there can be no assurance that PGE&#8217;s expectations, beliefs, or projections will be achieved or accomplished.

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	the effectiveness of PGE&#8217;s risk management policies and procedures;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	declines in the fair value of securities held for the defined benefit pension plans and other benefit plans, which could result in increased funding requirements for such plans;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>

</TD>

	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	cyber security attacks, data security breaches, or other malicious acts that cause damage to the Company&#8217;s generation and transmission facilities or information technology systems, or result in the release of confidential customer, employee, or Company information;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	employee workforce factors, including potential strikes, work stoppages, transitions in senior management, and a significant number of employees approaching retirement;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#POR201610K_HTM_SADBBBD1F1A125EA8B49E90BBA5A61C2B">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Any forward-looking statement speaks only as of the date on which such statement is made, and, except as required by law, PGE undertakes no obligation to update any forward-looking statement to reflect events or circumstances after the date on which such statement is made or to reflect the occurrence of unanticipated events. New factors emerge from time to time and it is not possible for management to predict all such factors or assess the impact of any such factor on the business or the extent to which any factor, or combination of factors, may cause results to differ materially from those contained in any forward-looking statement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="POR201610K_HTM_S5525DCA395BF525D8544307202B3DDAC">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations (MD&amp;A) is intended to provide an understanding of the business environment, results of operations, and financial condition of PGE. MD&amp;A should be read in conjunction with the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements contained in this report, and other periodic and current reports filed with the SEC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	PGE filed its 2016 IRP with the OPUC in mid- November 2016. The areas of focus for the 2016 IRP include, among other topics, acquisition of additional resources that may be needed in order to meet RPS requirements and to replace energy and capacity from Boardman, which is scheduled to cease coal-fired operations at the end of 2020. For further information on the Company&#8217;s 2016 IRP, see
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8220;Integrated Resource Plan&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	in the Regulation section of Item 1.&#8212;&#8220;Business.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#242424;">
	During 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	PGE committed to join the western EIM with a target participation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#242424;">
	date in the fall of 2017. The EIM is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;a real-time energy wholesale market that automatically dispatches the lowest-cost electricity resources
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#242424;">
	, while optimizing use of renewable energy over a large geographic area.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	For further information on the Company&#8217;s participation in the EIM, see
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8220;Future Energy Resource Strategy&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	in the Power Supply section of Item 1.&#8212;&#8220;Business.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The State of Oregon passed Senate Bill 1547, effective March 8, 2016, a law referred to as the Oregon Clean Electricity and Coal Transition Plan (OCEP). The legislation prevents large utilities from including the costs and benefits associated with coal-fired generation in their Oregon retail rates after 2030, with certain exceptions, and increases the RPS percentages in future years. For further information on the OCEP, see &#8220;Legal, Regulatory and Environmental&#8221; in this Overview section of Item 7.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The discussion that follows in this MD&amp;A more fully describes these and other operating activities and provides additional information related to the Company&#8217;s legal, regulatory, and environmental matters, results of operations, and liquidity and financing.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="POR201610K_HTM_SF75518EC54D9425D9F5EA4B760DF2250">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Carty
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8212;On July 29, 2016, Carty, a natural gas-fired baseload resource in Eastern Oregon, was placed into service. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, PGE had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$634 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in Electric utility plant in service related to Carty. The Company currently estimates that the total capital expenditures for Carty will be approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$640 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	. This cost estimate does not reflect any amounts that may be received from the Sureties pursuant to the Performance Bond or from the Contractor or Abengoa S.A. This estimate also excludes approximately&#160;$17 million&#160;of lien claims filed against PGE for goods and services provided under contracts with the former Contractor. The Company believes these liens are invalid and is contesting the claims in the courts. For additional details regarding various legal proceedings related to Carty, see Note 17, Contingencies, in the Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8.&#8212; &#8220;Financial Statements and Supplementary Data.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The final order issued by the OPUC on November 3, 2015 in connection with the Company&#8217;s 2016 General Rate Case authorized the inclusion in customer prices of capital costs for Carty of up to $514 million, as well as Carty&#8217;s
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	40
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#POR201610K_HTM_SADBBBD1F1A125EA8B49E90BBA5A61C2B">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	operating costs, at such time that the plant was placed into service, provided that occurred by July 31, 2016. As Carty was placed in service on July 29, 2016, the Company was authorized to include in customer prices, effective August 1, 2016, its revenue requirement necessary to allow for recovery of capital costs of up to $514 million associated with the construction of Carty, as well as operating costs. The price change consisted of an $85 million annualized increase related to cost recovery of Carty and a $41 million annualized decrease ($17 million over the remainder of 2016) related to the amortization of certain customer credits through supplemental tariffs. As actual project costs for Carty have exceeded $514 million, the Company has incurred a higher cost of service than what is reflected in the current authorized revenue requirement amount, primarily due to higher depreciation and interest expense.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On July 29, 2016, the Company also requested from the OPUC a regulatory deferral for the recovery of the revenue requirement associated with the incremental capital costs for Carty, starting from its in service date, to the date that such amounts are approved in a subsequent GRC proceeding. The Company has requested the OPUC delay its review of this deferral request until the Company&#8217;s claims against the Sureties have been resolved. Until such time, the effects of this higher cost of service will be recognized in the Company&#8217;s results of operations, as a deferral for such amounts would not be considered probable of recovery at this time, in accordance with GAAP. Incremental expenses related to Carty, primarily due to depreciation and amortization, were $3 million for the year ended December 31, 2016 and are estimated to be $6 million in 2017. Any amounts approved by the OPUC for recovery under the deferral filing would be recognized in earnings in the period of such approval.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="POR201610K_HTM_SAD0F0312D328595C95511B464CD0ABCD">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Capital Requirements and Financing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8212;PGE&#8217;s capital requirements amounted to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$596 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$190 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;related to the construction of Carty, excluding AFDC. The remainder of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;capital requirements related to ongoing capital expenditures for the upgrade, replacement, and expansion of transmission, distribution, and generation infrastructure, as well as technology enhancements and expenditures related to hydro licensing and construction. During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, the combination of cash from operations in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$553 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and proceeds from issuances of FMBs and unsecured term loans in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$290 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;funded the Company&#8217;s capital requirements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Capital requirements in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;are expected to approximate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$610 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	. PGE plans to fund the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;capital requirements and current maturities of long-term debt of $150 million with cash from operations during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, which is expected to range from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$450 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and the issuance of debt securities of approximately $450 million. These amounts do not include any estimated proceeds to be received from the Sureties pursuant to the performance bond, which cannot be reasonably estimated at this time. For further information, see the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Liquidity
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8221; and the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Debt and Equity Financings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8221; sections of this Item 7.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="POR201610K_HTM_SCE206689B9E8501B8408F65023C0B19A">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	General Rate Cases
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8212;PGE plans to file a 2018 GRC with the OPUC by the end of February 2017 that will be based on a 2018 test year and include investments to ensure system safety and reliability and better meet customers&#8217; changing needs and service expectations. Regulatory review of the 2018 GRC is expected to occur throughout 2017, with new customer prices effective in January 2018.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	In February 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	PGE filed with the OPUC a 2016 GRC, which was based on a 2016 test year and included costs related to Carty. In November 2015, the OPUC issued an order in the Company&#8217;s 2016 GRC, intended primarily to allow recovery of costs associated with the construction and operation of Carty. The annual revenue requirement change was implemented in two phases, with the first, a decrease, effective January 1, 2016 consisting of a reduction in base business costs and a decrease related to the amortization and recognition of certain customer credits through supplemental tariffs. The second phase was a price increase, consisting of the combination of an increase related to the cost recovery of Carty and a decrease related to the amortization of certain customer credits through supplemental tariffs, effective when Carty was placed into service. For further discussion on Carty, see
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8220;Carty&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	in this Overview section of Item 7.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The 2016 GRC filing, as well as copies of the orders, direct testimony, exhibits, and stipulations are available on the OPUC website at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	www.oregon.gov/puc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="POR201610K_HTM_SC2373E4BF98553E59CDE84BBD7E6DBAC">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Operating Activities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8212;PGE is a vertically integrated electric utility engaged in the generation, transmission, distribution, and retail sale of electricity, as well as the wholesale purchase and sale of electricity and natural gas in the United States and Canada to meet its retail load requirements. The Company generates revenues and cash flows primarily from the retail sale and distribution of electricity to customers in its service territory in the State of Oregon.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The impact of seasonal weather conditions on demand for electricity can cause the Company&#8217;s revenues and income from operations to fluctuate from period to period. Historically, PGE has been a winter-peaking utility that typically experiences its highest retail energy demand during the winter heating season, although increased use of air conditioning in the Company&#8217;s service territory has caused the summer peaks to increase in recent years and the long-term load forecasts show summer peaks exceeding winter peaks. Retail customer price changes and usage patterns, which can be affected by the economy, also have an effect on revenues while wholesale power availability and price, hydro and wind generation, and fuel costs for thermal plants can also affect income from operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	41
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<DIV>
<A NAME="POR201610K_HTM_S2D46B0AED11F5B2F9D9C281B39001950">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#POR201610K_HTM_SADBBBD1F1A125EA8B49E90BBA5A61C2B">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Customers and Demand
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8212;In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, retail energy deliveries decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, which was driven by decreases in industrial and commercial energy deliveries, partially offset by an increase in residential energy deliveries. For
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, the average number of retail customers and deliveries, by customer type, were as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	(2.5
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	)%
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:MIDDLE;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
